Lowglow, another one of those games that are plucked from the unknown corners of Steam. I also think that this game deserves more credit than it actually gets. Lowglow is a relaxing, audiovisual puzzle game, in which the player has to guide small balls of light into a portal situated on the map, to conquer the darkness and light the whole universe. 33199439.review:
Das Spiel ist gut.

Es ist an sich ein reines Rätselspiel. Noch viel mehr ist es für mich aber ein wunderschönes, geradezu meditatives, visuelles und akustisches Erlebnis.

Die etwa 100 Rätsel sind nicht sonderlich schwer. Nur einige (spätere) Level waren fordernd.

Ziel ist es, bei A emittierte Kügelchen durch mit der Maus gezogene Linien so umzulenken, dass sie bei B ankommen.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=963442973

Oft ist es ziemlich offensichtlich, was zu tun ist und das klappt dann auch mit etwas Feinjustierung.

Manchmal ist die gefundene Lösung auch eher eine Zufallslösung, weil selbst winzige Veränderungen (wie bei dem Schmetterlingseffekt, oder beim Billiard) schnell große Wirkung erzeugen können.

Die oft erforderliche wiederholte Zehntelmillimeterarbeit bei der Anpassung der Linien mit der jeweiligen Prüfung, ob es jetzt endlich passt ist das einzige, was etwas ermüdend sein kann. Wirklich schlimm ist es aber nie.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=963446462

Dafür ist die Physik des Spiel sehr gut. Die Kugeln fliegen immer an die gleiche Stelle. Die wirkenden Kräfte scheinen sehr gut berechnet zu werden und selbst wenn 20 Kugeln unterwegs sind, kam bei mir nichts ins stottern.

Jeder Level hat eine vorgegebene Maximalzahl an Linien. Es gibt aber rund 25 Zusatzlinien, von denen man maximal eine pro Level einsetzen darf. Umgekehrt kann man in einigen Leveln auch mit weniger Linien auskommen (was letztlich eine Errungenschaft freischaltet, aber sonst nichts bringt, außer, sich clever zu fühlen).

Die Level können nur der Reihe nach bewältigt werden, was aber wohl keine Schwierigkeit darstellen sollte.

Das Spiel hat auch eine Geschichte, die aber sowas von überflüssig ist.

Absolut beeindruckt war ich von dem audiovisuellen Erlebnis, das das Spiel bietet. Es wirkt irgendwie spährisch, wenn die Kügelchen, eine Leuchtspur nach sich ziehend, ihre Bahnen ziehen. Stossen sie auf ein Hindernis (und das passiert meist oft) erzeugt es einen entsprechend passenden Klang. Sind entsprechnd viele Kugeln unterwegs, ergibt dies geradezu optisch illustierte Musik.

Manchmal kann man es direkt darauf anlegen, möglichst viele Kugeln unterwegs sein zu lassen, indem man sie passend abprallen lässt, so dass die Ergebnisse wirklich reizend sind.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=963448544

Die Steuerung mit der Maus ist simpel und funktioniert sehr gut.

Gewisse Finessen fehlen dem Spiel. So wird nicht angezeigt, wieviele Linien man bei vorherigen Versuchen benötigt hat. Man weiss entsprechend nicht, wo man sich noch verbessern sollte, wenn man das wollte.

Zudem hätten durchaus mehr wirkliche Herausforderungen gut getan (abseits von der Millimeterarbeit manchmal).

Die wenigen Errungenschaften sind mit etwas Aufwand wohl alle gut erreichbar (wenn man die Reservelinien nicht benutzt, denke ich).

Pro & Contra:

+ Wunderschönes audio-visuelles Erlebnis
+ Hübsche, nicht sehr schwere Aufgaben

o Keine wirkliche Herausforderung

Wertung: 8/10

Lowglow ist wirklich schön anzuschauendes kleines Erlebnis, mehr Meditation als Rätselnuss. Ich fands toll.

31926573.review:
[h1]Das Leuchten in der Dunkelheit [/h1]


[b]Gameplay[/b]
In Lowglow müssen in jedem Level die fliegenden Bälle in in den leuchtenen Bereich leiten. Dabei ist das einzige Hilfsmittel die Linien, welche wir zeichnen können. Besonders viel muss man dabei nicht über die Level nachdenken, das Schwierige ist es, den richtigen Winkel zu treffen, damit die Bälle auch zielgerichtet fliegen. Sollten wir zuviele Linien benötigen, können wir noch eine zusätzliche goldene einsetzen, welche dann quasi gepfändet wird und jederzeit wieder eingesammelt werden kann, wenn man das Level später noch meistert. Diese goldenen Linien verdient man in jedem Levelabschnitt und kann man zum Öffen von Extraleveln benutzen. 
Das Spiel unterteilt sich in 5 Bereiche (=Stadtviertel), welche jeweils eine neue Komponente mit ins Spiel fließen lassen. So wechseln z.B. Bälle, die eine orangene Wand treffen, die Flugrichtung. 


[b]Story[/b]
Meiner Meinung nach braucht ein so simples Puzzlespiel keine Geschichte aber seis drum. Die Stadt Umbralite ist in Finsternis gehüllt, nur wenig Licht ist verfügbar um die böse Dunkelheit abzuhalten. Nun erscheinen wir als "Lowglow", welches die Stadt mit jedem Levelbereich neu erleuchtet. Jedes der 4 Stadtviertel besitzt einen eigenen Wächter, welcher uns manchmal mehr und manchmal weniger billigt. Denn umso mehr wir erleuchten, umso stärker verbrauchen wir die Energie, die noch vorhanden ist und beschleunigen so das Ende. Die Frage ist nun, ob wir die totale Finsternis abwehren können. Metaphorisch betrachtet, könnte man die ganze Geschichte ja schon irgendwie auf die Dunkelheit im Herzen des Menschens umdichten. Aber ich quacksalbere hier wieder rum.


[b]Grafik/Sound[/b]
Lowglow ist doch recht minimalistisch. Es gibt keine Deko, sondern nur die schimmernen Steine, welche gleichzeitg Teil des Gameplays darstellen. Allerdings ist der Stil hier bewusst gewählt und die Grafik wirkt entspannt auf die Augen. 
Die Musik ist auch sehr an das Gameplay gebunden. So ertönen bei jedem Aufprall der Bälle eigene Klänge und man kann sich so sein eigenes Konzert gestalten. Generell ist die Musik sehr hallig, ein wenig, als ob man in einer Kirche sitzen würde. (Allerdings auf eine entspannende Weise) Auf sprachliche Synchronisation wurde verzichtet, stattdessen wird in einer erfundenen Sprache geredet, ähnlich wie in "Little Big Planet".


[b]Fazit[/b]
"Lowglow" ist ein sehr entspanntes und ruhiges Spiel, bei dem man super abschalten kann und gemütlich "rumprobieren" kann. Gameplay, Musik und Grafik arbeiten wirklich super zusammen und vermittelt ein Gefühl der inneren Ruhe. 
Es ist mit einer Spieldauer von etwa 4-5 Stunden recht kurz und ich würde auf ein Angebot warten, um es zu kaufen. Unter 5 € würde ich zuschlagen!


Wenn dir das Review gefallen hat, würde ich mich freuen, wenn du meiner Kuratorgruppe auf Steam folgst, um auch meine Reviews zu anderen Spielen zu bekommen: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool

25432201.review:
这个游戏很玄很妙！

[h1]大致介绍一下游戏的机制[/h1]
能量小球的颜色会伴随所碰到的不同色块而发生变化，同时，不同颜色对应着不同的性状：
蓝色是向下的倾向
棕黄色是向上的倾向
绿色是保持原有运动状态的倾向
玫红色则意味着能量小球会被消除
除此之外，还有各种颜色的黑洞和小虫洞，小虫洞之间往往是相互连通的，而大黑洞则能够使得各种颜色的能量小球都强制发生偏转。
玩家需要通过划一种特殊性质的“线”来帮助能量小球越过各种障碍最终到达目的地。特殊性质的“线”不会使得触碰这条线的能量小球有任何的能量损耗，从而能量小球能够按照光的反射定律发生偏转。按照游戏的背景设定，这个解谜过程意指用聚合的光能去照亮黑暗的核心，加上游戏中每个章节开始时的古怪的人脸和深邃难解的画外音，游戏似乎依托了宗教神秘色彩来烘托气氛，并把破除无尽的黑暗作为了游戏的背景性主题。除此之外，游戏还把无尽黑暗和宇宙玄想关联在了一起，由于BGM和光影色彩方面的匹配度十分高，玩家在玩的时候能够充分体验到黑暗或者未知宇宙所带来的那种神秘凝重的感觉。

[h1]优点：[/h1]
+BGM出色
+光影色彩出色
+每个谜题过关时的解谜回放都十分有观赏性
+关卡设计丰富（关卡真的非常多，主线五大块区域，每个区域都有好几章节，每一章节都有好几个谜题，每个谜题还都有名字。。。除此之外，主线过关之后，还能够用主线关卡解谜中没有消耗掉的“金色的线”来解锁更多的奖励关卡，数量堪比主线）
+有云同步云备份功能

[h1]缺点：[/h1]
-划线的精确度要求太高太高太高太高太高，高得让人抓狂，仅仅差一点点都会使得能量小球偏得不是一点点
-因为上面这一点，全成就并不简单，对于不擅长这类解谜游戏的玩家而言甚至意味着全程都是困难模式。由于隐藏的成就是要求玩家在至少30个关卡里使用比给定数量要少的线来完成解谜，这会使得想要全成就的玩家每一关都努力思考如何减少用线，然而，有时候并不是玩家没有想到该如何划线，而是由于划线的精度要求实在太高，无论如何都达不到想要的效果，最终不得不放弃

我一口气花了6个小时不到达成了全成就，不过说实话，玩的时候心里真的是被超高精确度这一点烦得要死要活的。最后有两个成就是要求解锁奖励关卡，只要求解锁，不要求全部过关。所以我这六个小时并不包含通关所有奖励关卡的时间。全成就对我而言就算完成游戏了，不想再自虐了啊，毕竟都自虐六个钟头了呗。。。

不过，话说回来，瑕不掩瑜，这款游戏绝对属于良品，感兴趣的朋友们不妨买来玩上几些关卡，体验一下其中玄妙神秘的感觉。

Excellent for what it is. An audiovisual puzzle experience. The game is entirely about using angles of impact and acceleration of these little "droplets" of light. The game makes clever use of the augmentation of gravity, singularities and portals to make for at least 7 hours of individually challenging puzzles. However, you can easily break 10 hours if you're striving for those achievements. 

The echoing, tranquil visuals and audio make for a relaxing environment, especially for some of the more challenging levels. Excellent job.

As far as the little storyline that goes along with it, it's lacklustre. Although it certainly makes for a story, you can tell the developer didn't lose much sleep on it.

At $3 on sale, I don't feel I could have found a much better puzzle game. At some point I'll probably play it again :)

Visuals: 10/10

Thanks for the experience.

23879688.review:
Crayon Physics + Peggle + Auditorium

Pleasant atmosphere, tricky but forgiving physics-based ricochet puzzles.

Droplets fall from a spawn point, and you must place straight lines on the screen to bounce the droplets toward the goal. Once a line has been placed, you move it around or fine-tune the angle by just moving an endpoint. There's no time limit, but you have a limited number of lines to draw per level, and you must hit the goal several times in a row to cement your success. Each zone adds a new twist (gravity effects, etc). Successfully completing a level adds to your stock of "golden lines" which can be used once-per level if you need more than the provided number of lines. Many of the levels can be beaten "under par" for added challenge.

I'm a sucker for the glowing crystal aesthetic used here; the visual & sound designs are clean and pleasant, and the ambient background tones make it a relaxing puzzle experience.

Pylon / 10

23410409.review:
Lowglow is a tale about restoring light to the world. As the last surviving member of your species, you must traverse an area, bringing light back to it, while harnessing the lowglow. At the end is the Darkness who must be defeated at all costs.

Lowglow is a very relaxing puzzler that takes you on a journey of physics while introducing some fun mechanics along the way. The music is very calming and can even bring you out of a rage after playing Linea, the game. :P

Music: Extremely calming and relaxing. For a change, I didn't put anything else on in the background. I was very soothed by it and even when I was having issues getting the puzzles right, I didn't mind because the sound effects and music were just so peaceful. This was right after playing Linea, which is highly rage inducing, so that is a consideration in how calming the music is.

Graphics: Fairly simple, but well designed for what it is. Not much more than what is presented is needed. Nothing is too intense, and it also helps to create a rather peaceful atmosphere.

Story: Pretty simple. Not very deep or exciting, but then this is mostly a puzzle game. I would have been fine without a story to be honest. But that it has one at all, is just a bonus. 

Controls: Mouse driven. Nothing else is really needed. Easy to work and is intuitive. 

Gameplay: Pretty simple, bounce the light to the end goal. Using physics and some mechanics you'll get it there. The game slowly introduces new ideas in each chapter and they are fairly easy to understand, but a bit harder to master.

Overall: 7.5/10 - Seriously as a nice calming puzzle game, this game is really good. I thoroughly enjoyed myself over the course of several hours. While I haven't 100%'ed it yet, I have beaten the main story and look forward to going back and mastering the rest of the levels. Once you complete the game, there are extra bonus levels to complete. The base price of $8 honestly isn't a bad thing. I mean, sure you could get it on sale for cheaper, but it's not a bad way to spend your money, just know that it has been bundled before.

Lowglow is a very interesting puzzle game. The goal of the game is to get a ball that keeps bouncing around and/or changing its path or even going through teleporters into the designated area. This you do by placing your own lines of which the ball bounces or changes trajectory. 
There's also a story in the background, you having to light up the darkness with your puzzle solving.

This is not a game for those without the patience to think through the trajectory and plan out the path. Some levels actually require some excessive planning.

All in all, I've enjoyed it, played through all 5 levels, it was fun, not very hard, but some levels were demanding. 
Even tho I got this game for free, I kind of think 9,99e is too much for something like this even if the developers put some time into this game (you can tell by the 'craftsmanship' and the attention to details).

I recommend people trying it, but only if you're a puzzle lover.
A solid 6,8/10, it would have been in the 7's if the price wasn't so high.

22727337.review:
嗯，这是个弹球游戏。

打开游戏，前15分钟：这游戏好简单，好休闲，赶紧玩完拿成就走人。
45分钟：咦，这游戏意外地需要动脑，没事没事，至少每分钟都有新的进度。
2小时：啊啊啊啊啊，这游戏好难啊，这关，这么复杂，这怎么可能过去……

游戏规则很简单，就是建立挡板让小球反弹到指定位置。小球分为普通球、反重力球、失重球三种，碰到不同颜色砖块会改变小球的类型。每一关可用挡板数是固定的，如果实在过不去那一关，可以消耗稀有的黄金板来降低难度（虽然我一个都没用）

这款游戏每一关的地形都经过了精心安排，有些关甚至需要小球反弹十多次才能过关。所以细微的观察是很重要的，不过玩这款游戏的时候大部分时间都是在不停修改挡板细节，很多时候鼠标移动一像素就会导致结果差以千里，运气好时小球会乱弹一阵莫名其妙就过关了……

画面很简单，小球弹到墙壁上的声音很好听。
噢对了，这个游戏竟然有剧情，不过一个弹球游戏的剧情真的有人会看么……

总之，游戏制作得很用心。另，随时打开随时玩，随时存档随时关，对于玩游戏时间不多的人是一个好选择。

22638371.review:
[h1]Teal Deer[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Developers:[/b] Rockodile
[*][b]Publishers:[/b] Rockodile 
[*][b]Initial release:[/b] Dec 2015
[*][b]Genre:[/b] Puzzle. Atmospheric 
[*][b]#Worth/NotWorth:[/b] #Worth 
[/list]
[h1]Exposition, Concurrence and Summation[/h1]
Lowglow is a very interesting laid back affair that caught me by surprise. 

This is a puzzle game in which you draw lines and that's... basically it. Each stage is set up so that there is a max number of lines to be drawn in order to accomplish the goal. Which in the case of this game is to get a glowy bit into a blackhole repeatedly. It's not enough to get just one you need to get multiple in and additionally they need to be successive.

The lines you draw are bouncy and they fling the glowy bits relative to their polarity. There are gems. Lets call them gems, I'm not really sure what they are called. But they exist as obstacles in the stage. Their color has great significance as everything starts as blue. Pulling the glowy bits toward the bottom of the screen. The glowy bits adopt the last color gem and its properties that they have touched. There is also yellow, red and green. Yellow, as you might have guessed pulls the glowy bits up. Red, cancels the or destroys the glowy bits. Green however, not seen until later stages has no arc and go strait. So as stages get more intricate you must take into account the changing properties of the glowy bits.

There is also some strange narrative thrown in the form of gods being left in the dark and some pylons needing to be re-lit to recover the city or world. These are told in the form of some, being honest, creepy faces that float ambiguously in the sky and speak in very low incomprehensible dulcet tones. Of course that is on purpose as there is text directly underneath. 

I found the game to be extremely relaxing as there is no timer or no penalty for moving, changing reshaping or destroying lines. As the glowy bits recede and cascade across the gems into the night that make it a very ambient “wind chime in space” effect that is rather pleasant in that when making minor adjustments to your lines is very soothing not not all taxing. The game is instead scored by how many lines you use to accomplish your task. There are on some stages the chance to obtain “golden lines”. There are a finite number of these and should you use one of them in a difficult stage you lose it forever. The game says something to the affect that they remain there forever which scared me to use them at all because I didn't think I could readjust them but you indeed can. However once the stage is complete you loose the golden line. The only real loss is that these golden lines are also used for unlocking bonus stages outside the city. 

[b]THE GIST
A really great relaxing puzzle game that is great for in between games as a palate cleanser as well just something nice and enjoyable to play for atmosphere.[/b]

Tras ser un amante de los puzzles durante tanto tiempo, puedo decir que éste juego me sorprendió mucho, pues fue un juego regalado de una página de Bundles.

El juego se centra en un estilo de juego muy marcado, fácil de comprender, intuitivo, original y muy hermoso graficamente; aparte de una dificultad progresiva hecha para casuales; cabe destacar que es un juego extremadamente relajante.

Opinión final: 7/10.

22250011.review:
I got this game for free, and as a general rule, I enjoy physic based puzzle games.  This wasnt an exception.  Gameplay is simplistic, bounce the ball from a to b, using a predetermined number of lines.  I didnt find much of a difficulty curve as the levelled progressed which disapointed me, however I play a lot of these games, so it may be due to prior experience.  A new player may find the added challenges more, well, challenging.  The bonus content levels however, definitely upped the difficulty quite a bit, and those were by far the most enjoyable/frustrating puzzles of the game.

I could've done with out the cutesy defeat the darkness story line, but thats a personal preference, it wasn't overbearing, and didnt detract from the game much, (and theres the option to skip all cutscenes), I just prefer to grind games like these from start to finish, no story needed.  The ambience of the game was nice however, nothing amazing, but the minimalistic graphics and surrealish audio was a nice switch from most physics games.  Overall I'm going to give this game 7/10, I personally wouldnt pay 8$ for it, but I'd buy it on sale for 5$ or less.

22149308.review:
[h1]Lowglow the beautiful game which instantly relaxes you. [/h1]

Lowglow is a physics-puzzle game. The objective is getting the light-ball to the abyssm, to do this you have a limited set of glowing "ropes" that act as a trampoline, you must align these properly for the light-ball to bounce to the abyssm.

The game has a beautiful lightning and sound engine.

[u]Con's[/u]

-Phisics engine could be better.

[u]Pro's[/u]

+Beautiful art design.
+Beautiful glow theme.
+Great level design.
+Beautiful sound engine.
+Interesting story
+Great gameplay changes.(After each zone a new breed of objects to bounce on appear)
+Instantly relaxes you

Overall a great game to get your favourite mug, get some coffe, and just relax while you think of possible solutions for every exciting level. [b]Once you start you might not be able to stop [/b].
This is a great indie game, I hope we see more indie games so original and so spectacular as this one.

[spoiler]Overall a GREAT game worth every single penny I give it a 8.75/10 the phisics could do some more work but nothing to severe. [/spoiler]

If you liked the review and/or has helped you in any way please consider joining my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/proper_reviews#curation] Steam Curator [/url]

21830241.review:
一个非常好的有关物理反射的独立游戏，音乐十分简单但是非常契合游戏。
[h1] 剧情 [/h1] [spoiler] 非常宏大但是没什么卵用[/spoiler]
从黑暗中拯救四大家族，点亮灯塔，为他们带来光明[spoiler]但是第四个领主投靠了黑暗力量[/spoiler]。
[h1] 玩法 [/h1]
划一定数量的线使光球发生反射，最终进入水晶球（三个填满），要注意其中有重力作用，而且水晶球中的光球量会随着时间而减少，所以不能间隔时间过长。光球碰到红色部分会消失，碰到黄蓝绿三种颜色会改变成对应的颜色。黄色：重力向上（重力场翻转），绿色：忽略重力，蓝色：重力向下。每一个领域有四或者五部分，每一部分有若干个小的关卡。在每个部分会增加一条额外的金色的线，可以在游戏中使用，也可以用来解锁拱顶（额外部分）。如果之后重玩关卡不用额外的线，那么这条线还能收回来，这个设置很好。
[h1] 关于成就 [/h1]
游戏大部分成就只要完成关卡就能获得，隐藏成就是用少于给定条数的线过30关，[url=steamcommunity.com/id/195822734/screenshots/] 我个人的完成方法[/url]，事实上我有40多关都用了比给的线少完成了。另外一个是解锁全部拱顶，在通关后会再出现四个，加上每个领域的一个以及额外的一个自动解锁的，总共九个额外部分。
10/10   难得的好游戏， 同时让我明白[spoiler]我TM光学学的真差[/spoiler]

A really great game about light reflection. Its music is simple but matches the game very well.
[h1] Story [/h1] [spoiler]Really good but don't make sense[/spoiler]
Saving the four realm from the darkness, lighting the Pylon and bring light back to the Umbralite.[spoiler] But the fourth clan stood in the Darkness[/spoiler]
[h1] How to play [/h1]
Drawing some lines reflects the glowing ball and let it into the crystal ( filled with three balls). Remember there is the effect of gravity, and the ball in the crystal will fade with time, so we cannot do it with long interval. The glowing ball will disappear when it hit the red part and change into the corresponding color when it hit the yellow, green and blue parts. The yellow: turn the gravity up( turn over the gravity field; The green: avoid the gravity; The blue: normal gravity( drop down). Every Clan has 4 or 5 Levels, and every Level has several Cases. In the beginning of every Level, we will have an extra golden line, which can be used in the playing, and in unlocking vaults (new area). What's more, if you finish the Case again without extra lines, which you used extra lines before, you can still get these lines. That is a brilliant setting.
[h1] Achievements [/h1]
You can get most achievements if you finish the game. The hidden one is finish 30 Cases by using less lines than given. [url=steamcommunity.com/id/195822734/screenshots/] My ways get this. [/url] Actually at least 40 Cases can be done in this way since I got it. Another one is unlocking all vaults, it will show to you 4 extra vaults after you finish the game. Adding the 4 every Clan has and 1 auto-unlocked, there are 9 vaults in this game.
10/10 An excellent game, and let me know [spoiler]I did shit of light parts in my physics lessons[/spoiler]

Ce jeu possède un gameplay assez simple, puisqu'il suffit d'aller d'un point A vers un point B, mais le jeu se complexifie au fur et à mesure que l'histoire avance, et des mécaniques très intéressantes font leur apparition, tels que les téléporteurs ou l'anti-gravité.

L'histoire quant à elle est très simpliste, mais suffisemment captivante pour nous pousser à terminer le jeu. La bande son est parfaitement adapté à l'ambiance énigmatique que le jeu nous offre.
Franchement, pour 8€, je recommande vivement ce petit jeu Steam.

Hübsch und ein recht nettes prinzip.
Aber ich bin mir nicht sicher ob es die 8€ Wert ist 

Ziel des Spiels ist es ein Orb von punkt A nach B zu befördern, mit hilfe von Lichtstrahlen die man überall auf das Feld setzen kann, woran diese Bälle abprallen. Später kommen noch ein paar Mechaniken dazu die es ein wenig schwerer machen. Es ist ziemlich simpel, und es ist ein netter kleiner Zeitvertreib.

Es ist in Levels und "Welten" aufgebaut die man von Level zu Level durchquert. Zwischen diesen Welten gibt es auch Zwischensequenzen die Sowas wie eine Story mitteilen...

Ach ja... es hat auch ein Story, welche ich auch bewerten könnte... wenn ich nicht grade alle Sequenzen übersprungen hätte... 

Das Spiel bietet eine äußerst beruhigende Soundkulisse und ziemlich hübsche Lichter die Ein Großteil der Atmosphäre ausmachen. 

Von der Grafik und dem Sound abgesehen erinnert die Spielmechanik eher an Mobile Games die ich mir genau so gut auf dem PlayStore vorstellen kann. Hier bloß in HD und in 60fps.

Würde ich dieses Spiel empfehlen? Ja!
Würde ich dafür 8€ ausgeben? Nicht wirklich...

21429018.review:
(Game suggested by Zaraki Snakenoman.  Game provided by Rockodile social media.)

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=631864806

Prepare to cast your Magic Missile, because you're about to face off against the Darkness.  (...no really, that's pretty much the story)

Enjoy a game of "Bounce the ball of light to the exit by drawing lines" on an overworld that mimics a Simon board. (well...not exact, but very similar)  A decent puzzle game that'll take about 8-10 hours of gameplay before you reach completion without guides.

The game is pleasing to the eye and ear, but can get frustrating on later levels and bonus levels. (Which will pretty much require that bonus golden line you end up collecting)   However, this game is not without bugs.  I've found a few areas where my lightballs would squeeze into tight crevices that seem sealed and on one occassion, I completed a bonus world to be greeted by a non-existant level after the last level of the sector called "Level Name Here".

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=631864609

There isn't much to say about this game, but I will say that for the most part, the game was a pleasant experience.  Sadly, though, there isn't much replayability once you've finished aside from difficult bonus maps.

Is it worth paying full price?  To be honest, $7 is a little steep for this game.  If it was $5, that would be a fair price.  Though, $2.50 would be ideal.  Wait for a sale before you nab it.

6/10  A good, casual experience.

21385290.review:
[h1]Вы - свет во тьме[/h1]
Случаются моменты, когда среди промо-акций из ключей бесплатных игр попадается что-то стоящее.
И Lowglow - яркий пример крайне хорошей игры категории пазла.

[h1]Что вас в ней задержит:[/h1]
+ Мистическая атмосфера
+ Приятные звуки и музыкальный амбиент. Кусочки света звенят колокольчиками или чем-то похожим при касаниях поверхностей. Каждый звук - приятный
+ Никакой замудренности в механике, игра хорошо объясняет каждый новый свой элемент сначала довольно простыми уровнями, а потом их комбинируя со старым. При всём это сложность довольно приятная, достаточно, чтобы игра не выходила за рамки "релаксирующего пазла".
+ Игра не повторяет себя. Все уровни достаточно уникальны.
+ История! У пазла есть своеобразный рассказ, где вы в роли спасителя народа Света от поглощения Тьмой. С вами будут беседовать лидеры, пятеро старейшин, из диалогов с которыми вы будете познавать сюжет.

[h1]В чем есть недостатки:[/h1]
- В игре есть ачивки, они довольно простые, но есть одна зад*отская. Я бы не сказал, что это плюс для релаксирующей игры. Да ещё и скрытой сделали её, дабы люди гуглили чтобы вообще знать что нужно делать.
- Краши. После заставок в разных местах дважды ловил вылеты.

[h1]Итого[/h1]
Играть, к слову, советую в вечернее-ночное время суток, ибо такова игра. И, конечно, в покое.
Дешевая, бывала на раздаче, релаксирующая и приятная во всех отношениях.
Неоновый рай.

[h1]Оценка: A+[/h1]

Je to výborná oddychovka! Hra vás zabaví a k tomu si navíc procvičíte mozek. Hra má výbornou a jednoduchou hratelnost, rychle vás zabaví a pár minut u ní zůstanete. Kola jsou jak těžká tak jednoduchá.

Od těchto věcí se kuličky odrážejí, ovšem takto se do portálu nedostanete. Kuličkám musíte pomoci pomocí plošin, které různě stavíte a přesouváte od kterých se kuličky odrážejí. 

K závěru musím říct, že hra má jen drobné nedostatky a zpočátku obtížnější způsob pochopení ovládání a orientace ve výběru kol (to může být mojí nevyspalostí :-D ) . Hru tedy určitě DOPORUČUJI a abych to dokončil, hra OBSAHUJE kartičky! :-)

21358758.review:
这个游戏美轮美奂，适合一个人夜深人静的时候玩儿。

      这游戏包含若干关卡，每个关卡的最终目标就是把光粒送进玻璃珠。每个关卡会有一个光粒发生器——没错就是类似于阴极射线管的电子枪。

      玩家的目标就是用您手中的鼠标画出一个光板，从而让光粒改变运动轨迹。这是一个非常有趣的过程，因为您需要不断微调光板的角度和位置——这个过程可谓是失之毫厘谬以千里！

      整个游戏伴随着舒缓的轻音乐。当光粒与各种各样美丽的水晶碰撞，会发出清脆的声音。没错，一个个光粒的碰撞就像是某个音乐大师随手、不经意的弹奏。它会让您的耳朵放松、放松、再放松。

      某天推荐给一位朋友，他是一个充满幻想的人，第二天就告诉我这个游戏有更深的含义。我向他请教。他跟我说：这是一个秘密，很神圣！我百思不得其解，后来他告诉我这其实是精子和卵子结合的过程——精子不断发射，历经艰险到达卵细胞。它神圣而又美好，诠释了“繁衍”这么一个亘古不变的主题！

Picked this up in the sale for ~£4.20 and have completed the game including all the bonus levels.

Overall a simple but enjoyable puzzler, I found most of the main levels fairly straight forward but there were a couple I had to come back to. 

Took me about 4.5 hours to finish everything (except an achievement for "Complete 30 levels with less lines than the given amount". I've only completed 19).

Higher levels require lateral thinking and a few (especially bonus levels) require pin-point placement of your lines. Personally, I play this to relax so don't mind spending the time to tweak lines, but I imagine some may find it mildly tedious.

You can skip a level if you want to, but you won't be able to unlock all bonus levels until you've gone back and solved them.

Very enjoyable, pity it isn't slightly longer. The developer is adding a level editor which should help.

19593681.review:
Interesting designs, challenging levels and nice visual presentations make this game worth playing. 

The only thing I want to discuss is the bonus puzzles. I doubt there should be any "motivation" of the solution for some of them.  I solved vault 1 by first noticing a chaotic behaviour in the intersection of two forcing fields, then putting the line there and adjusting for around 100 different angles (subtle adjustments, obviously). And not surprisingly, even the smallest adjustment of the position will lead to a completely different outcome.

I think when you have two constant force fields acting in the opposite direction with possible reflections (as in vault 1), the system becomes highly chaotic. I mean not even normal dynamical systems like a double pendulum but much more complicated governing systems. It is therefore almost impossible to know what should work out - you just have to keep trying.

More surprising is vault 4, it has a constant forcing field and an electric field (as the particle gets repelled), I believe the system should be 100x more complicated that the above case and have not yet figured out the correct position of the second line. You need a huge acceleration from the forcing field, but I don't know whats the initial condition. 

Maybe I am just not playing in the correct style, but aside from the bonus puzzles everything work out fine for me.

Also, it will be extremely helpful if there is a replay mode - Some of the curvatures are amazing.

19544222.review:
Brilliant relaxing puzzle game. Obviously, a lot of thought and work has been put into this, and the price is totally justified, despite a rather low gameplay length (expect around 6 hours to finish everything). The gameplay itself can be summed up with this : draw lines (limited in numbers) to make "balls" (or drops) bounce towards the goal. Expect a few tricks along the way (to make it quick : some balls fall down, others up, some go straight, depending on their colors and the last object they touched, teleporters and so on). Graphics and sound are great, and perfectly fit the game.

However, no game is perfect ;)

- a couple of levels are finished thanks to luck rather than skill
- maybe there's a deep meaning behind the "story", but frankly, we could have done without it and get a little more levels instead :p
- I had one crash : during the "cutscenes" when the 4 quarters light up. However, when I launched the game after that, it started right where the crash happened and everything went smooth after that
- no easy way to tell in which levels you used the exact number of lines allowed or if you did better. As a result, replaying (to do better) is a pain.
- at the moment, one achievement is bugged ("finish a level without losing a drop" : it should be fixed in next update), and another is not unlocking (I suppose it's a "get all achievements" one, and is a consequence of said bug).
- sometimes, drawing the lines next to the edges is a bit frustrating
- it looks like a level editor is on its way, but no sign of it at the moment ;)

EDIT : the bugged achievement was indeed fixed. As for the other one (hidden), it's actually "do 30 levels with less lines than provided". Not easy but doable, and if you go after it, you may expect around 10 hours of gameplay :)

These are very minor flaws. Game definitely recommended and a big bravo to the devs for a very well thought-out game

19539208.review:
[h1]Game introduction[/h1]
Lowglow - an audiovisual puzzle journey. Glowingly beautiful graphics combined with a dynamic audio environment make sure that Lowglow is an unforgettable, mind-bending experience for you!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G49zPRYoU6w
[h1]Comments[/h1]
+[b]Graphics[/b] are very simple, yet colorful and fit well with the puzzle theme. The lighting is well done with multitudes of light sources casting shadows across the levels.

+[b]Soundtrack/ambience[/b] are incredibly soothing and makes for a deep atmosphere.

+[b]Puzzling[/b] involves drawing and managing lines that make small light particles bounce. The goal of each level is to get enough light particles to the target. As the particles bounce, they produce musical notes and small pathways; you can make more music by providing the particles with a longer, more complex pathway to the goal.

+[b]Mechanics[/b] are simple and yet charming to the point where you feel like messing around trying to find all the different ways to complete a level. (producing a variety of music while doing so)

+[b]Difficulty:[/b] There is a strong learning curve: you must find new ways to get the light particles to the goal. This gets increasingly difficult when progressing to new stages. New colored blocks are introduced, as well as other obstacles in the environment.

+[b]Story[/b] is quite the interesting one. As you complete levels, you will encounter dialogues that shed more light on what is happening in the game.

-[b]Dialog[/b] is a little out of place at times, and sometimes a little awkward.

-May be a few bugs, but other then dialog, this game does not have many negative connotations

[h1]Final Overview[/h1]
Lowglow is a great little atmospheric puzzle game boasting crisp graphics, soothing soundtrack, and simple yet enjoyable mechanics. Furthermore, at a sale price or normal price of $7.99, Lowglow is worth your money. As a bonus, the developers are planning on adding level editor and steam workshop, which would both immensely help the game with content. 

[h1]Verdict: 8/10[/h1]

19514569.review:
When I first saw “Lowglow” in the Upcoming section, I was impressed enough to take the relatively uncommon risk of posting its announcement in my Activity feed (an action that has bit me on my donkey on occasion.) This time I absolutely made the correct choice.

“Lowglow” is a casual, meditative puzzle game composed of colors, lights and sound. Lights fall from the “sky”, and must be guided by the player to that puzzle’s target, somewhere on the screen. This is done by placing, and angling, one or several “bouncy” lines. There is no time restraint, no rush (except for one specific achievement.) The lights fall, and bounce, and change direction and speed based on color and type of the object they contact. “Lowglow” is, in fact such a simple game, conceptually, that I find it difficult to produce an interesting review, though to not make the effort would be tragic.

Sometimes it seems the object of “Lowglow” isn’t necessarily to simply reach the target, but to create the most beautiful, and musical, pathway of flowing and singing lights in the process. I suspect there are “best” methods, but the presence of achievements based on supra-par success indicates that there are many, perhaps dozens, of winning choices for each level. This is also a strong indication of replayability. The line(s) must be placed and angled very precisely, so a knowledge of physics and Newton’s laws of gravity will certainly come in handy. Lines can very easily be placed, changed, moved and deleted. Controls could not be simpler.

I don’t know how long “Lowglow” gameplay lasts, but after about 2 hours I have only 2 of 12 achievements, so I suspect the increased difficulty of further levels will add quite a lot of time to game completion. (As levels are locked until accessed, I can’t speak further at this point.) As well, there is an editor in the works to add even more interest and wonder. Sometimes I find myself grinning from amazement at the complexity of a winning scene.

Along with “Lowglow” gameplay is a pleasant and entertaining story of exploration, and (one presumes) spiritual growth. While interesting to some, this can be easily skipped by those that wish, as it doesn’t seem necessary to the puzzle mechanics. The puzzle mechanics themselves seem to be such that as soon as it seems the game grows easy, something new is encountered that must be investigated thoroughly through vigorous investigation of the effects of gravity and propulsion.

“Lowglow” is a wonderfully entertaining game with a superior learning curve and significant challenges. It’s a bit more expensive than most conceptually similar puzzle games, but by no means excessively so, and quite possibly the editor will add completely new dimensions to explore. It can be played very easily while doing almost anything else that you may find to be of less interest (such as meetings or conversations.) At this stage I can only express a feeling that this game was created as a labor of love, and to play it is no labor at all.

39522555.review:
Un jeu que j’avais laissé plusieurs mois de côté, mais en m’y replongeant pour le finir, j’ai pu constater ses qualités par rapport à d’autres jeux auxquels j’ai pu jouer entre temps.

Le but est simple, faire acheminer des billes jusqu’à destination, en jouant sur les rebonds que vous pourrez modifier en dessinant quelques lignes aux endroits stratégiques.
Le placement de ces lignes est vraiment précis, et chaque modification est prise en compte, avec le grand avantage que les billes tombent sans arrêt, vous ne perdez pas si elle sorte de l’écran (on peut prendre son temps), mais au moins vous pouvez immédiatement voir où elles vont, et constater les changements que vous venez de faire. 
De plus le fait que ça tombent en continue rajoute un petit côté addictif, vous avez vite envie de voir ce que ça donnerait en modifiant ceci ou cela.

Et un autre point très appréciable, c’est qu’il n’existe pas qu’une seule solution à chaque fois, vous aurez un nombre donné de lignes par niveau, mais vous pourrez le finir avec moins, ou même avec plus, car au fil du jeu, vous pourrez gagner des lignes bonus à utiliser en supplément dans les niveaux qui vous poseraient problème.
De ce fait j’ai trouvé la difficulté très bien gérée, et au fil de la progression on tombera dans les niveaux sur des surfaces réagissant différemment avec les billes.

En revanche entre les chapitres il y a un semblant d’histoire (en anglais) à laquelle je n’ai pas accroché dès le début, et j’ai fini par passer les dialogues sans rien lire, l’intérêt se trouve de toute façon dans les niveaux.
